DOC.brief_summary: Study Design : Longitudinal Experimental Study Objective : Analyze relationship Upper Limb Neural Tension Test ( ULNTT1 ) cervico-thoracic spine biomechanics use new motion-capture spine movement data analyze model base Least Square Approximation . Summary Background Data : ULNTT1 test able determine cervical nerve root brachial plexus displacement within interface structure . No study conduct ULNTT1 cervico-thoracic spine motion pattern relationship . Methods : 12 subject ULNTT1 asymmetry > 10° ( AS group ) 11 subject ULNTT1 symmetry ( S group ) clinical test enrol study . Subjects analyze ULNTT1 electrogoniometer use two parameter , one operator one patient-dependent . Fine lateral bend cervico-thoracic spine motion pattern collect motion-capturing technique data analyze Least Square Approximation tool . Subjects impairments cervico-thoracic spine mobility undergo correction spinal manipulative therapy . ULNTT1 spine mobility re-evaluated method .
DOC.brief_title: Longitudinal Experimental Study ULNTT Cervico-Thoracic Spine Motion Patterns Relationship
DOC.criteria: AS group : ULNTT asymmetry > 10° S group : ULNTT symmetry History neck , shoulder arm surgical intervention major trauma , peripheral neuropathy , mental disturbance , limitation shoulder , elbow wrist range motion , BMI > 25 .
